## Field Sites
This web-app shows the sites where operate Eddy Covariance towers and Flux Chamber sites in wetlands across the Metro Vancouver.

* Click the points to sites to see more information.

## Currently Operational Sites
### Burns Bog 1
:::: {.columns}

:::{.column width="65%"}

* [Data Preview Graph](https://ibis.geog.ubc.ca/~micromet/data/burnsbog.html#) (CA-DBB) (2014 - *, Delta, BC, Canada)
* Download Data for [CA-DBB](https://ameriflux.lbl.gov/sites/siteinfo/CA-DBB) from Ameriflux.
* Data from the web plots are available [here](https://ibis.geog.ubc.ca/~micromet/webdata/resources/csv/) (prefix BB. note that this is raw data – no filtering or QCQA. Database codes are available [here](https://ibis.geog.ubc.ca/~micromet/research/Burns-Bog/Database/BB.html).
* [BB1 Site Photos](https://www.flickr.com/gp/188943790@N03/22bQJ7) (also see [Dr. Andreas Christen's](https://ibis.geog.ubc.ca/~achristn/projects.html) previous [photos](https://www.flickr.com/photos/140969380@N07/albums/72157666939177185/with/26139296480) from when he held his position at UBC)

### UBC Climate Station on Totem Field
* Access to [custom data download](http://137.82.254.122/DataExport.aspx) of standard measured meteorological observations (air temperature, humidity, precipitation, soil temperatures, solar irradiance, wind) measured since 1958. Data can be downloaded in .csv format.

## Code and Documentation
Our <a href="https://github.com/ubc-micromet">lab github</a> hosts code for flux processing, README docs for our lab, and various other bits of information.

More documentation related to maintenance procedures for our sites can be found <a href="https://ubc-micromet.github.io/Documentation.html">here</a>.
